blocks.label: Purpose of Creation
blocks.english: To Delight Â· In Those Who Fear Him
blocks.tagline: Why was the world created? So that God could delight in those who fear Him. Every prayer, every mitzvah brings × ×—×ª ×¨×•×— (spiritual pleasure) to the Creatorâ€”and this is the purpose of our existence.

details.title: The Creator's Pleasure
details.content: When a person prays, studies Torah, and serves God through mitzvos, God experiences tremendous joy. As the Sages teach regarding sacrifices: × ×—×ª ×¨×•×— ×œ×¤× ×™×•â€”'it brings a pleasant spirit before Him, because His will was fulfilled.'

details.title: Sos Asis B'Hashem
details.content: The verse 'I will greatly rejoice in God' means: I rejoice in the fact that I bring joy to God through my actions. Our joy should come from knowing that our service truly matters to the Infinite One.

details.title: The Wonder of It
details.content: A being formed from a putrid drop, whose end is worms and decay, can rise so high through their actions that they bring pleasure to the Holy One! This itself is one of God's greatest kindnesses and wonders.

blocks.label: Shemini Sheb'Sheminis
blocks.english: An Eighth of an Eighth Â· The Pride We Need
blocks.tagline: The Talmud says we need 'an eighth of an eighth of pride.' This cryptic measure means: we must have confidence that our service matters to Godâ€”anything less borders on heresy.

details.title: The Danger of False Humility
details.content: If someone says 'What am I that God should have pleasure from my actions?'â€”they may think this is humility. But it's not! Such an attitude actually borders on ××™× ×•×ª (heresy), denying God's love for us.

details.title: What Is the 'Eighth'?
details.content: The 'world of delight' (×¢×•×œ× ×”×¢×•× ×’) is called the 'eighth measure.' Binah (Understanding) corresponds to this realm. When we need 'joy from joy'â€”delight that God has delight from usâ€”this is ×©××™× ×™×ª ×©×‘×©××™× ×™×ª.

details.title: Where Not to Be Humble
details.content: Be humble in all mattersâ€”except this one. We should NOT say, 'How can I, formed from clay, bring joy to the Creator?' In this alone we must have confidence: our service truly brings God joy.

blocks.label: The Tzaddik's Power
blocks.english: The Tzaddik Decrees Â· God Fulfills
blocks.tagline: Through prayer, tzaddikim can actually annul Divine decrees. The Sages teach: 'Who rules over Me? The tzaddik! God decrees, and the tzaddik annuls it.' This is God's greatest delight in Israel.

details.title: Like a Father with His Son
details.content: This is like a father who delights so much in his child that he nullifies his own will for the child's sake. As Shimon ben Shatach told Choni HaMe'agel: 'You are like a son who acts spoiled before his father, and the father does his will.'

details.title: When This Works
details.content: This happens only when Israel is beloved before God. In times of ×”×¡×ª×¨ ×¤× ×™× (concealment of God's face), the situation differs. But when beloved, the tzaddikim can actually change outcomes.

details.title: Yisrael Asher Becha Espa'ar
details.content: God takes such pride in Israel, as the verse says: ×™×©×¨××œ ××©×¨ ×‘×š ××ª×¤××¨â€”'Israel, in whom I take pride.' He wants us to have influence over His decrees.

blocks.label: Elokeinu vs. Elokim
blocks.english: Our God Â· Governance Connected to Us
blocks.tagline: When we say ××œ×§×™× ×• (our God), we mean: His governance is, as it were, ours. We can transform judgment to mercy. The tzaddikim have power to shape how God rules the world.

details.title: Why the Suffix Matters
details.content: The Name YHVH never takes a suffixâ€”we don't say 'Hashem-einu.' But Elokim does: ××œ×§×™×›×, ××œ×§×™× ×•. This is because Elokim describes God as Judge, and when we're righteous, His judgments are connected to our influence.

details.title: Hashem Elokeinu Hashem Echad
details.content: Rashi explains: 'Hashem who is now our God (not the nations') will in the future be Hashem Echad.' Currently, nations receive abundance not through Israel. But in the future, everyone will see that all flows through us.

details.title: Elijah's Generation
details.content: At Mount Carmel, they cried 'Hashem Hu HaElokim'â€”without suffix. Why? Because that generation wasn't righteous. The miracle was to sanctify God's Name, not in their merit. Hence 'Elokim' alone, not 'Elokeinu.'

blocks.label: Haman's Claim
blocks.english: Their God Is Sleeping Â· The Challenge
blocks.tagline: Haman claimed that the attribute of ××œ×§×™× ×•â€”where God responds to Israelâ€”is 'asleep,' not active. Since the Temple was destroyed, Israel no longer has power to annul decrees.

details.title: What 'Sleeping' Means
details.content: When someone has good qualities but doesn't use them, we say those qualities are 'sleeping.' Haman claimed that God's responsiveness to Israelâ€”the ××œ×§×™× ×• attributeâ€”was dormant, not active.

details.title: The Psalm's Plea
details.content: This is what the Psalmist meant: ×¢×•×¨×” ×œ××” ×ª×™×©×Ÿ ×”×³â€”'Awake! Why do You sleep, O Lord?' The plea is for God to 'activate' His quality of responsiveness to Israel, transforming from 'Elokim' to 'Elokeinu.'

details.title: Nebuchadnezzar's Same Error
details.content: Nebuchadnezzar tried to sing songs declaring 'God does as He wishesâ€”period.' His message: no room for human influence. The angel slapped him to ensure the world continues to be governed according to Israel's prayers.

blocks.label: The Secret of Mishloach Manos
blocks.english: Ish L'Rei'eihu Â· God to His Friends
blocks.tagline: Mordechai and Esther tore up a heavenly decree through prayerâ€”proving that even in exile, tzaddikim can overturn decrees. ××™×© ×œ×¨×¢×”×• = God (××™×©) sending a gift to His friends (the tzaddikim).

details.title: 'Ish' Refers to God
details.content: The Midrash teaches that ××™×© (man) can refer to God, as in ×”×³ ××™×© ××œ×—××”â€”'Hashem is a Man of war.' So ××©×œ×•×— ×× ×•×ª ××™×© ×œ×¨×¢×”×• = the gift from God to His 'friend'â€”the tzaddik.

details.title: Israel as God's 'Friends'
details.content: The Gemara teaches that Israel is called 'brothers and friends' to God regarding this ability to annul decrees. Among the nations, none can do what God does. But Israel? Elijah revived the dead, controlled rainâ€”tzaddikim do what God does!

details.title: The Gift = Prayer Power
details.content: What gift does God send? The power to annul decreesâ€”this is a ××ª× ×” (gift) sent from God to the tzaddikim. Even the thought to pray comes from Above as a gift.

rows.nebuchadnezzar: 'As He wishes with hosts of heaven'

blocks.text: The Thought That Comes to the Tzaddik

blocks.title: Everything Comes from God
blocks.intro: Even though tzaddikim can annul decrees, we must know that everythingâ€”including the thought to prayâ€”comes from God.

items.content: Divine Inspiration: When a thought comes to a tzaddik to prayâ€”that thought itself is from God! There is no thought without Divine involvement. All holy thoughts come from Him.
Good Decrees: When a good decree is issued, it's revealed to all worlds and descends through the chain of worlds to reach Israel belowâ€”openly and publicly.
Harsh Decrees: When a harsh decree is issued, God sends the thought to pray secretly, hidden from the upper worlds. He discreetly inspires the tzaddik so the credit goes to them.

blocks.outro: Like a father helping his son discover an insight so it can be called 'the son's discovery'â€”God gives us the inspiration and then attributes the victory to us.

items.description: When God decrees good because of Israel's merit...
items.detail: They deserve the rewardâ€”it's not a gift. Their righteous actions earned the favorable decree through the normal channels of Divine justice.

items.description: When Israel deserves harsh judgment but God inspires prayer...
items.detail: The inspiration to pray is a pure gift! They don't deserve it; it comes from God's abundant kindness. This is ××©×œ×•×— ×× ×•×ªâ€”the gift God sends.

rows.why: One cause â†’ two effects (love for Israel, judgment on enemies)
Two distinct visible outcomes (joy for Jews, downfall of Haman)

blocks.title: Measure for Measure
blocks.intro: Why was Nebuchadnezzar transformed from human to beast? Because he denied the two ways God 'fulfills the will' of created beings.

items.content: Internal (Pnimiyus): When Israel is righteous, God fulfills their willâ€”tzaddikim can annul decrees through prayer. Nebuchadnezzar denied this exists.
External (Chitzoniyus): God constantly renews creation; every creature wants to remain as it was created, and God maintains each being in its form. This is basic Divine kindness.
The Punishment: Since Nebuchadnezzar denied Israel's influence, God withdrew even the external kindnessâ€”maintaining him as human. He wanted to stay human, but that wish was not granted.

blocks.outro: He denied Israel's power to have their wishes grantedâ€”so his own wish (to remain human) was not granted. Measure for measure.

blocks.text: The Destruction of the Yetzer for Idolatry

blocks.content:
In the merit of Purim, the early Second Temple era saw the 'killing' of the ×™×¦×¨ ×”×¨×¢ for idolatry. Previously, there was actual spiritual pleasure in idol worship! How? Holy thoughts pass through the 'world of delight'â€”when the Temple stood, even misdirected thoughts could tap into that flow.

The Men of the Great Assembly removed thisâ€”now only holy pursuits can draw from the 'world of delight.' This occurred in Mordechai's merit. He embodied the truth that God is the source of all lifeâ€”making it impossible to draw pleasure from idolatry.

items.title: The 'Pride' We Must Cultivate
items.body: Don't doubt that your service matters to God. 'What am I that my prayers should make a difference?' isn't humilityâ€”it borders on denial of God's love. Know with certainty that your service brings Divine joy.

items.title: Mishloach Manos as Spiritual Awakening
items.body: When you give mishloach manos, contemplate: God gives us the gift of being able to influence outcomes through prayer. Every inspiration to pray, to do teshuvah, is itself a Divine gift.

items.title: 'Their God Is Sleeping' - Not on Our Watch
items.body: Every prayer that's answered, every decree that's overturned, proves that 'Elokeinu' is awake. Our task is to live with awareness that God delights in us and responds to us.

items.title: Like a Father with His Son
items.body: God gives us the insight, then lets us take credit for the discovery. Like a father teaching his son, He wants our prayers to 'succeed.' What extraordinary love!
